alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 3:43PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...An outflow boundary will impact portions of southern Warren, southern Henderson, McDonough, northeastern Hancock, southwestern Des Moines and northeastern Lee Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 341 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary along a line extending from near Avon to near Raritan to near Iowa Army Ammunition Plant. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Disco around 345 PM CDT. La Harpe around 350 PM CDT. Prairie City around 355 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Blandinsville, Sciota, Niota, Colchester, Ferris, Tennessee, Colusa, Adrian and New Philadelphia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
